title: The One With the Dozen Lasagnas

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, everyone is there. Ross working on
crossword puzzle, starts humming theme from The Odd Couple . Chandler joins in,
followed by Monica and Phoebe, then the whole gang. Ross starts humming theme from I
Dream Of Jeannie .]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No-no-no-no, we're done.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is on the phone in the kitchen.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Aunt Syl, stop yelling! All I'm saying is that if you had told me vegetarian lasagna, I would have made vegetarian lasagna. (pauses, listens to person on phone) Well, the meat's only every third layer, maybe you could scrape.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ross, did you really read all these baby books?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yup! You could plunk me down in the middle of any woman's uterus, no compass, and I can find my way out of there like that! (snaps fingers)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ooh, this is cool...it says in some parts of the world, people actually eat the placenta. (Joey grimaces)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And, we're done with the yogurt. (Sets yogurt down on table)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (softly) Sorry. (Camera pans back to Monica, still on phone)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Aunt Syl, I did this as a favor, I am not a caterer. What do you want me to do with a dozen lasagnas? (listens to Aunt Syl on phone, looks shocked) Nice talk, Aunt Syl. (in New York accent) You kiss Uncle Freddie with that mouth?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey Ross, listen, you know that right now, your baby's only this big? (measures about 2 inches with his thumb and index finger) This is your baby. (in baby-like voice) Hi Daddy!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (waves) Hello!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (in baby-like voice) How come you don't live with Mommy? (pause; shows Ross less than amused) How come Mommy lives with that other lady? (pause; Ross still looks less than amused; Joey smiling) What's a lesbian? (playfully hits Ross)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Honey, you can say it, Poconos, Poconos, it's like Poc-o-nos (touching Paolo's nose with forefinger with each syllable)

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: Ah, poke (Paolo touches Rachel's nose) a (touches nose again) nose, mmm (they rub noses, then kisses her)

dialogue.speaker: AND ROSS
dialogue.text: (sitting in living room, imitating Paolo) Mma, Mma, Mmaah

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So, did I hear Poconos?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yes, my sister's giving us her place for the weekend.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Woo-hoo, first weekend away together!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, that's a big step.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I know...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Ross) Ah, it's just a weekend, big deal!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wasn't this supposed to be just a fling, huh? Shouldn't it be...(makes flinging motions with hands) flung by now?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I mean, we are way past the fling thing, I mean, I am feeling things that I've only read about in Danielle Steele books, you know? I mean, when I'm with him, I'm totally, totally...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: ...nauseous, I'm physically nauseous. What am I supposed to do, huh? Call immigration? (pauses, looks suddenly inspired) I could call immigration!

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Hallway, Chandler and Joey leaving girls' apartment, carrying lasagna.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I love babies, with their little baby shoes, and their little baby toes, and their little baby hands...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ok, you're going to have to stop that, forever!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Need a new table.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You think?

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Carol and Susan's, there's a knock on the door and Carol answers it to Ross.]

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Hey hey, come on in!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, hello! mmwa! (kisses Carol) I brought all the books, and Monica sends her love, along with this lasagna.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Oh great! Is it vegetarian, 'cause Susan doesn't eat meat.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (pauses) I'm pretty sure that it is...

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: So, I got the results of the amnio today.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (making flinging gestures with hands) Oh, tell me, tell me, is everything, uhh....?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Totally and completely healthy!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, that's great, that is great! (Hugs and kisses Carol. Then picks up a picture frame)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, when did you and Susan meet Huey Lewis?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Uh, that's our friend Tanya.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (surprised, chuckling nervously) Of course it's your friend Tanya. (looks up frightenedly)

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Don't you want to know about the sex?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (chuckles nervously) The sex? (chuckles) Um, I'm having enough trouble with the image of you and Susan together, when you throw in Tanya (miming washing hair, that's the best I could think of), yaw...

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: The sex of the baby, Ross.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, you know the sex of the baby? Oh, oh-oh-oh!

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Do you want to know?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no, no, no, no, I don't want to know, absolutely not. I think, you know, I think you should know until you look down there, and say, oop, there it is! (pauses) Or isn't...

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Oh, hello Ross!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Susan...

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: So, so, did you hear?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes, we did, everything's A-OK!

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Oh, that's so... (Susan hugs Carol, they giggle, Ross steps away) It really is...do we know...?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Yes, we certainly do, it's going to be...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (flailing arms in protest) Oh, hey hey hey, ho ho ho, hello, guy who doesn't want to know, standing right here!

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Oh, well, is it what we thought it would be?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Mm-hmmm (Susan and Carol hug, giggling. Ross stands back, reaches out and lightly taps Susan's shoulder)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok, what, what...ok, what did we think it was going to be?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL AND SUSAN
dialogue.text: It's a...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (interrupts) No, no, no I don't want to know, don't want to know. Ok, you know, I should probably, I should probably just go.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Well, thanks for the books.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No problem, ok, mmmwa (kisses Carol) oh, mmmwa (kisses Carol's stomach, then punches Susan's shoulder) Susan... (Ross leaves.)

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: All right, who should we call first, your folks, or Deb and Rona? (intercom buzzer rings)

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Hello?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (on intercom) Uh, never mind, I don't want to know. (Carol and Susan laugh)

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's,  Joey and Chandler use their knees as a table to
support the lasagna.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ok, so it's just because it was my table, I have to buy a new one?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: That's the rule.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What rule? There's no rule, if anything, you owe me a table!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: How'd you get to that?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, I believe the piece of furniture was fine until your little breakfast adventure with Angela Delvecchio

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You knew about that?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, let's just say the impressions you made in the butter left little to the imagination.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ok, ok, How about if we split it?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What do you mean, like, buy it together?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You think we're ready for something like that?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Why not?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, it's a pretty big commitment, I mean, what if one of us wants to move out?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Why, are you moving out?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm not moving out.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You'd tell me if you were moving out right

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah, it's just that with my last roommate Kip...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Aw, I know all about Kip!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: It's just that we bought a hibachi together, and then he ran off and got married, and things got pretty ugly.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, let me ask you something, was Kip a better roommate than me?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Aw, don't do that

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Phoebe's Massage Parlor, Phoebe's assistant is telling her about the changes to
her schedule.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE'S ASSISTANT
dialogue.text: We've got a couple changes in your schedule. Your 4:00 herbal massage has been pushed back to 4:30 and Miss Somerfield canceled her 5:30 shiatsu.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ok, thanks. (assistant leaves, then walks back in)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE'S ASSISTANT
dialogue.text: Oh, here comes your 3:00. I don't mean to sound unprofessional, but, yum (walks out, Paolo enters)

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: Buon Giorno, Bella Phoebe!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, Paolo, hi, what are you doing here?

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: Uh, Racquela tell me you massage, eh?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, Racquela's right, yeah!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, okay, I don't know what you just said, so let's get started.

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: Uh, I am, uh, being naked?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, that's really your decision, I mean, some people prefer, you know, to take off...oh whoops! You're being naked!

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, everyone but Phoebe is there.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to Ross) I can't believe you don't want to know. I mean, I couldn't not know, I mean, if, if the doctor knows, and Carol knows, and Susan knows....

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: And Monica knows...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wha, heh, how could you know, I don't even know!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Carol called me to thank me for the lasagna, I asked, she told me.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So what's it gonna be? (Monica whispers in Joey's ear. Ross gets up and waves arms frantically in protest)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wait—oh—hey—huh, oh great now he knows, and I don't know!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, I'm just excited about being an aunt!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Or an uncle...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY AND CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey Phoebe!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi Pheebs!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Pheebs!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Fine!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Phoebe, what's the matter?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Nothing, I'm sorry, I'm just, I'm out of sorts.

dialogue.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogue.text: Hey, can we get some cappuccino over here?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, right, that's me!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, Chandler, that table place closes at 7, come on.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Fine. (Joey and Chandler walk towards the door)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Phoebe, what is it?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: All right, you know Paolo?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm familiar with his work, yes...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, he made a move on me.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Whoa, store will be open tomorrow!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: More coffee over here, please!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, what happened?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, he came in for a massage, and everything was fine until. (A flashback starts Paolo, lying on massage table, moving his hands up Phoebe's legs.)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY AND CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ooooohh!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: My God.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Are you sure?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, I'm sure. (Flashback resumes with Phoebe doing a voiceover.) And all of a sudden his hands weren't the proble

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Was it...?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, boy scouts could have camped under there.

dialogue.speaker: GUYS
dialogue.text: Oooooo....

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: "Ooo," what?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Uma Thurman.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: The actress!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thanks Rach.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So what are you gonna do?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You have to tell her! You have to tell her! It's your moral obligation, as a friend, as a woman, I think it's a feminist issue! Guys? Guys? (waiting for guys to chime in)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, you have to tell her.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Feminist issue. That's where I went!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: She is gonna hate me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (sympathetic yet...) Yeah, well...

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Table Store, Joey and Chandler and looking for their new table.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Will you pick one, just pick one! Here, how about that one? (points to a table)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That's patio furniture!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So what, like people are gonna come in and think, "Uh-oh, I'm outside again?" Of course!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (gesturing towards another table) What about the birds?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I don't know, birds just don't say, "Hello, sit here, eat something."

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You pick one.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right, how about the ladybugs?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, so, forget about the birds, but big red insects suggest fine dining!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Fine, you want to get the birds, get the birds!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Not like that, I won't! (pauses) Kip would have liked the birds! (Joey turns and gives Chandler a dirty look)

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel folding and packing clothes in suitcases as Phoebe
enters.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi Pheebs!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Are you moving out?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, these aren't all my suitcases. (picks up small blue suitcase and shows to Phoebe) This one's Paolo's.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, um, Rachel can we talk for a sec?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, sure...just a sec, though, 'cause Paolo's on his way over.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh! (sits down) Ok, um, ok, um,

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, Pheebs, Pheebs...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ok, um, (clears throat) we haven't known each other for that long a time, and, um, there are three things that you should know about me. One, my friends are the most important thing in my life, two, I never lie, and three, I make the best oatmeal raisin cookies in the world. (Phoebe opens a tin and offers Rachel a cookie)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (taking cookie) Ok, thanks Pheebs (takes bite of cookie, overwhelmed) Oh my God, why have I never tasted these before?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, I don't make them a lot because I don't think it's fair to the other cookies

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right, well, you're right, these are the best oatmeal cookies I've ever had.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Which proves that I never lie.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I guess you don't.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Paolo made a pass at me.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ross, Chandler, Joey, and Monica admiring their new
table.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So, what do you think?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I think It's the most beautiful table I've ever seen.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I know!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So how does this work, you going to balance the plates on these little guys' heads?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Who cares, we'll eat at the sink! Come on, let's play!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Heads up Ross! (Monica scores on Chandler and Joey) Score! (points at Chandler) You suck!

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is recovering from the shock.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Are you okay?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I need some milk.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ok, I've got milk (takes thermos from her bag and starts to pour a cup) Here you go... (Rachel drinks straight from thermos) Oh!(Rachel finishes thermos) Better?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No... oh , I feel so stupid! Oh, I think about the other day with you guys and I was all "Oh, Paolo, he's so great, he makes me feel so..." Oh, God, I'm so embarrassed!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I'm so embarrassed, I'm the one he hit on!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Pheebs, if I had never met him this never would have happened!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL AND PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I'm so sorry! No I'm sorry! No I'm sorry! No I'm sorry!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, wait, oh, what are we sorry about?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don't know...right, he's the pig!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Such a pig!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, God, he's such a pig,

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh he's like a...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: He's like a big disgusting...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: ...like a...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: ...pig...pig man!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yes, good! Ok...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (voice wavers) Oh, but he was my pig man...how did I not see this?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (raises hand) Oh! I know! (Rachel startled) It's because... he's gorgeous, and he's charming, and when he looks at you...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ok, Ok, Pheebs...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: The end.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, God...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Should I not have told you?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, no, trust, me, it's, it's, it's much better that I know. Uh, I just liked it better before it was better...

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Phoebe is telling everyone how it went across the hall as
the foosball game continues.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I think she took it pretty well. You know Paolo's over there right now, so...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: We should get over there and see if she's okay. (switching places with Ross) Just one...second! Score! (Monica scores, high-fives with Ross) Game! Come on. (Monica and Phoebe leave)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (wiping his brow) Ah...ooh! Well, looks like, uh, we kicked your butts.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No-no, she kicked our butts. You could be on the Olympic standing-there team.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Come on, two on one.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What are you still doing here? She just broke up with the guy, it's time for you to swoop in!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What, now?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yes, now is when you swoop! You gotta make sure that when Paolo walks out of there, the first guy Rachel sees is you, She's gotta know that you're everything he's not! You're like, like the anti-Paolo!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: My Catholic friend is right. She's distraught. You're there for her. You pick up the pieces, and then you usher in the age of Ross! (Ross and Chandler look off into the distance. Joey, wondering what they are looking at, looks in the same direction)

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's Balcony, Rachel is throwing Paolo's clothes over the side.]

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: No, that's cold, that's cold, that's...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering) How's it going?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Don't stare. Now she just finished throwing his clothes off the balcony, now there's just a lot of gesturing and arm-waving, (shows Rachel gesturing with hands in front of her chest), Ok, that is either, "How could you?" or, "Enormous breasts!" Here he comes!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ooh!

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: Uh, I am, uh, to say good-bye.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, ok bye-bye.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Paolo, I really hate you for what you did to Rachel, (hands him a lasagna) but I still have five of these, so heat it at 375 until the cheese bubbles.

dialogue.speaker: PAOLO
dialogue.text: Grazie.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Paolo, I-I just want to tell you and I think I speak for everyone when I say... (shuts door in his face and walks away)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, just look at her... (girls move toward Rachel on the balcony)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh you guys, I-I really think just one of us should go out there so she's not overwhelmed...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, you're right.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (pulls Monica back) ...and I really think it should be me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You all right?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ooh, I've been better...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Come here. (he hugs Rachel) Listen, you deserve so much better than him...you know, I mean, you, you, you should be with a guy who knows what he has when he has you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, Ross...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I am so sick of guys. I don't want to look at another guy, I don't want to think about another guy, I don't even want to be near another guy. (Ross crosses arms)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Huh.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh Ross, you're so great!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ohhhh (Hugs her and sighs)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ooh...hey honey, are you all right?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You ok?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: ...medium...hmm...any cookies left?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yep!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: See, Rach, uh, see, I don't think that swearing off guys altogether is the answer. I really don't. I think that what you need is to develop a more sophisticated screening process.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No. I just need to be by myself for a while, you know? I just got to figure out what I want

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh, no, no, see, because not...not all guys are going to be a Paolo.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, I know, I know, and I'm sure your little boy is not going to grow up to be one.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (astonished) What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I-I'm, I'm having a boy?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Uh...no. No, no, in fact, you're not having a boy.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wha-I'm having, I'm having a boy! (babbling) Huh, am I having a boy?

dialogue.speaker: GIRLS
dialogue.text: Yes, you're having a boy! (Monica runs over and hugs Ross)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm having a boy! Oh, I'm having a boy!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Wha-

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Wha-

dialogue.speaker: JOEY AND CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What is it?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm having a boy! I-I'm having a boy!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY AND CHANDLER
dialogue.text: We already knew that! (they hug)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm having a son. Um...

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Monica is busy killing Chandle and Joey at foosball.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yes ! And that would be a shut-down!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY AND CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Shut-out!! (They both start heading for their rooms.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Where are you guys going? Come on, one more game!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Uh, it's 2:30 in the morning!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, get out!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You guys are always hanging out in my apartment! Come on, I'll only use my left hand, huh? Come on, wussies! (Joey and Chandler pick her up) All right, ok, I gotta go. I'm going, (they throw her out) and I'm gone.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Joey) One more game?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh yeah!
